CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security
JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Ján Šikuta;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested by the police on suspicion of having committed , inter alia , several counts of fraud , receiving stolen goods , bribery , forgery , deception , drug trafficking and inciting to theft while acting in an organised criminal group . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) ordered his detention . It relied on the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences with which he had been charged and on the risk that , as a former police officer , he might tamper with evidence . It referred to the likelihood of a severe sentence of imprisonment being imposed on the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the charges against the applicant were severed from the main proceedings instituted against several suspects . The case was referred to the Bielsko - Biala District Court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . It relied on the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences with which he had been charged , the need to secure the proper conduct of the investigation and the complexity of the case . It also stressed that his detention was justified by the need to obtain further evidence , in particular to obtain expert reports , to take evidence from witnesses and suspects and to confront witnesses and suspects .
CARDINAL . The detention order was subsequently extended by the Bielsko - Biała District Court on DATE , DATE and DATE . The court repeated the grounds given in the previous decisions .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Apelacyjny ) extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . It relied on the reasonable suspicion that the applicant had committed the offences with which he had been charged , which was supported by evidence from witnesses and co - accused . Moreover , the court found that there was a reasonable risk that the applicant would obstruct the proper conduct of the proceedings , having regard to the fact that he had formerly been a police officer . It also referred to the likelihood of a severe sentence of imprisonment being imposed on the applicant and to the complexity of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested access to the case file .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Prokurator Okręgowy ) refused the applicant access to the case file . He relied on the risk that the applicant might attempt to tamper with evidence . Furthermore , the prosecutor stated that the applicant would be granted access to the case file later in the proceedings , at the close of the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the impugned order , finding that the applicant ’s defence rights had been limited only temporarily and that the refusal of access to the case file was necessary for the proper conduct of the investigation .
CARDINAL . On DATE a bill of indictment was lodged . However , the court decided to return the case to the prosecution authorities for additional investigation .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the Bielsko - Biala District Court extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . The court repeated the grounds given in the previous decisions .
CARDINAL . On DATE a new bill of indictment was lodged . It listed CARDINAL charges laid against members of an organised criminal group .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . On DATE ORG extended that period to DATE . The applicant ’s detention was subsequently extended on DATE , CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The courts relied on the grounds stated in the previous decisions .

CARDINAL . In the course of the investigation and the court proceedings the applicant made numerous unsuccessful applications for release and appealed , likewise unsuccessfully , against refusals to release him and against decisions extending his detention .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the court held CARDINAL hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE Court convicted the applicant as charged and sentenced him to CARDINAL years’ imprisonment . He appealed . The applicant ’s detention was subsequently extended on CARDINAL occasions .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the first - instance judgment . At the same time it extended the applicant ’s detention until DATE . The court considered that the reasons for keeping him in detention were still valid .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG extended the applicant ’s detention to DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicant ’s request , he was released from detention .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the court held QUANTITY hearings .
CARDINAL . NORP The proceedings are still pending .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with the ORG ( PERSON ) , under LAW on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( LOC o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłoki ) ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) .

CARDINAL . The applicant sought a ruling declaring that the length of the proceedings from DATE , that is , the date of delivery of the first - instance judgment , to DATE ( the referral of the case to the court of second instance ) had been excessive .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed his complaint . The court held that there were no delays for which ORG could be held responsible . It referred to the complexity of the case , the time needed for the preparation of written grounds for the judgment , which comprised CARDINAL pages , and problems with serving CARDINAL of the defendants with a notice concerning his appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a new complaint about a breach of the right to have his case heard within a reasonable time . He sought a ruling declaring that the length of the proceedings after DATE had been excessive .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Bielsko - Biala Regional Court rejected his complaint , relying on section DATE CARDINAL Act ( under this provision a fresh length complaint in the same proceedings can not be lodged DATE from the date on which a court has given a decision concerning the first length complaint ) .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning the imposition of detention on remand ( aresztowanie tymczasowe ) , the grounds for its extension , release from detention and rules governing other “ preventive measures ” ( środki zapobiegawcze ) are stated in the ORG ’s judgments in the cases of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE , and PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V , and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII .
As regards the above - mentioned section CARDINAL of LAW ( paragraph CARDINAL ) , it reads , in so far as relevant , as follows :
“ The applicant may lodge a new length complaint in the same proceedings not DATE ... from the date on which a court gave a decision referred to in sectionCARDINAL . ”
